title: IoE² IoT API - to create end-user applications

ttl.description: Desired maximum life-time in seconds for the refresh token

name.description: Name of the device. User defined.
Name of the *Device* as defined by the user. Can be used for user interfaces.
Name of the *Device* as defined by the user. Can be used for user interfaces.

autonomy.description: Average electricity autonomy in % (value in range [0, 1], rounded)

message.description: Message for cases where computation is not possible (codes 200001, 200002)

ElectricityMissingFlows.description: List of missing flows (not available either directly or indirectly)

message.description: Message for cases where computation is not possible (codes 200001, 200002)

selfConsumption.description: Average self-consumption rate in % (value in range [0, 1], rounded)

ElectricityStatusCode.description: Status code. 200000 means OK. Other codes indicate full or partial failure.

ElectricityStatusMessage.description: Message for cases where computation is not possible (codes 200001, 200002)

ErrorEntity.description: An error related to access to an entity (400, 403, 404, 410)

ErrorGatewayUnreachable.description: The gateway of the Place is not reachable.

ErrorSubEntity.description: An error related to access to an sub-entity (400, 403, 404, 410)

FunctionalityCreated.description: A resource has been created. The `resource` property gives its reference.

Locale.description: Locale identifier (language, region). See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646 and https://www.iana.org/assignments/lang-subtags-templates/lang-subtags-templates.xhtml .

Metadata.description: Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

add.description: list of pairs key/value to add/replace

MetadataSelected.description: Subset of metadata attached to the resource selected using the 'embed-metadata' parameter

NotificationCreated.description: A resource has been created. The `resource` property gives its reference.

PhoneNumber.description: Phone number of the *User* in international format, for SMS notifications.

PlaceCreated.description: A resource has been created. The `resource` property gives its reference.

ProgramCreated.description: A resource has been created. The `resource` property gives its reference.

TimeZone.description: A time zone name from the Time Zone Database at https://www.iana.org/time-zones

canLogin.description: true if the user owning the account (can get tokens with /auth/login)

UserCreated.description: A resource has been created. The `resource` property gives its reference.

canLogin.description: true if the user owning the account (can get tokens with /auth/login)

lastUse.description: Time of last use of the token to access the API. Updated at most every 15 minutes. If absent, the token has never been used.

places.description: List of Places to which the User has access. If absent, it means any Place of the account are allowed.

self.description: True if this token is the one used for this API request

actions.title: Account.changePassword
actions.description:
Set a new password for the account.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.places
actions.description:
List the *Places* of the account.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.newPlace
actions.description:
Create a new *Place*.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.tokens
actions.description:
List the active *Tokens* on the account.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.revokeToken
actions.description:
Revoke the given *Token*.

**Note:** requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.users
actions.description: Get the list of *Users* of this *Account*.

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Account.newUser
actions.description:
Add a *User*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.deleteUser
actions.description:
Delete a *User* from this *Account*, and revoke all his/her *Tokens*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Account.getUser
actions.description: Get information about a *User* in the same *Account*.

actions.title: Account.patchUser
actions.description:
Modify a *User*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: User.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata.

actions.title: User.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: AuthAccountLogin
actions.description:
Get an access+refresh tokens pair from login and password information.

The *access token* obtained with this request can then be used in
an `Access-Token` HTTP header or in a `token` URL query parameter
in requests that require authentication.

The *refresh token* can be used with `/auth/refresh` when the *access
token* expires to retrieve a new *access token*. The lifetime of the
refresh token is the maximum lifetime of this authentication request.

The default lifetime of the *refresh token* is defined by the `appId`
used. The `ttl` input parameter allows to request a *refresh token*
with a shorter lifetime.

To implement *logout*, use `/auth/revoke`.

actions.title: AuthRefreshToken
actions.description:
Get a new *access token* using a valid *refresh token*.

This is a **replacement** of the *access token*: if an existing *access
token* was still not expired, it is invalidated.

actions.title: AuthResetPassword
actions.description:
Trigger the request of a new password.

The account administrator will receive an e-mail with an URL pointing to a form
to allow him/her to enter a new password.
The old password is still functional until a new one is submitted.

Either the login or e-mail of the account must be given.

actions.title: AuthRevokeToken
actions.description:
Invalidate the authentication used for the request. The access token and the refresh token will be invalid after this request.
This request is typically called to implement logout.

actions.title: Devices.get
actions.description: Get information about a *Device*.

actions.title: Devices.patch
actions.description: Modify information about a *Device*: its name.

actions.title: Device.addFunctionality
actions.description:
Add a *Functionality* to the device.

Required parameters are :
- functionality class
- endpoint

Each device class has its own restrictions on which Functionality classes can be added and on which endpoints.
Only a few devices allow to add Functionalities.

|Device class|Functionality class|Endpoints|
|------------|-------------------|---------|
|MINT        |CurrentPeriod      |1,2,3    |
|MINT        |ElectricityRates   |1,2,3    |
|MINT        |GenericRate        |1,2,3    |

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Device.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata.

actions.title: Device.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: Device.run
actions.description: Run an *Action* on zero, one or multiple Functionalities selected with tags.

functionalities.description: Functionality selector: Functionality tags or functionality class (optionally, '@' followed by a endpoint in decimal) or '*' for all. Multiple values are separated by '|' and are interpreted as « OR ».

actions.title: Device.getTags
actions.description: Get the tags of a *Device*.

actions.title: Device.patchTags
actions.description: Modify the tags of a *Device*.

actions.title: Functionalities.get
actions.description: Get the *Functionality*.

actions.title: Functionality.patch
actions.description: Modify information about a *Functionality*: its name.

actions.title: Functionality.values
actions.description:
Get the values of multiple *Attributes* and their history.

If the `names` parameter is not given, all the attributes of the *Functionality*
are returned. As the list may be huge, this must be avoided.

If the `to` parameter is set, `from` must also be set.

If `from` is not set, only the last value is returned.

The request may fail if too many values are asked.

names.description: One or multiple *Attribute* names separated by commas

to.description: End of the interval. Default: now.

actions.title: Functionality.value
actions.description: Get the *Attribute* value and the last time when it changed.

actions.title: Functionality.set
actions.description: Modify the value of the *Attribute*.

actions.title: Functionality.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata.

actions.title: Functionality.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: Functionality.run
actions.description: Run an action on the Functionality.

actions.title: Functionality.getTags
actions.description: Get the tags of a *Functionality*.

actions.title: Functionality.patchTags
actions.description: Modify the tags of a *Functionality*.

actions.title: Me.get
actions.description:
Get information on the authenticated *User* who does the request.

The *login* property is returned only if the *User* is the administrator of
the *Account*.

actions.title: Me.patch
actions.description: Update *User* information (locale).

actions.title: Notification.delete
actions.description: Delete a *Notification*.

actions.title: Notifications.get
actions.description: Get information about a *Notification*.

actions.title: Notification.patch
actions.description: Modify a *Notification*.

actions.title: Notification.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata of the *Notification*.

actions.title: Notification.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata of a *Notification*.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: Me.places
actions.description: List the *Places* to which the *Token* has access.

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Places.get
actions.description: Get information about a *Place*.

actions.title: Place.patch
actions.description:
Change information about a *Place*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Place.buses
actions.description:
Get the list of *Buses* available on the gateway of this *Place*.
If `withPairing` is `true`, return only buses that allow device pairing (see `/places/{placeId}/buses/{busId}/pairing`).

withPairing.description: Filter out buses that have no pairing window

actions.title: Place.pairing
actions.description:
Get the state of the pairing window of the *Bus*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Place.openPairing
actions.description:
Open/Close the pairing window.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Place.devices
actions.description: Get the list of *Devices* available in this *Place*.

devices.description: Devices selector. Device tags or device classes or device ids or '*' for any. Multiple values are separated by '|' and interpreted as « OR ».

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Place.Electricity.autonomy
actions.description:
Compute the autonomy rate of the *Place* on a time period.

`autonomy = 1 - (elec_drawn / elec_total_usage)`

when.description: A time part of the time span.

span.description: Timespan: H (hour), D (day), Wmo (week starting on Monday), Wsu (week starting on Sunday), M (month), Y (year)

actions.title: Place.Electricity.getFlows
actions.description:
Get the mapping of virtual electricity flows to functionalities.

Some rules are applied to expand the virtual flows using the concrete
flows available.

The `factor` tells how each energy value coming from a functionality
must be added with values from other functionality to compute the
energy of the virtual flow. Factors are usually `1` or `-1`.

The `code` property gives the result which may be partial:
- If all flows are available, `200000` is returned.
- If no flows are available (indicating that the place has no
  electricity functionality or that no functionality has been attached
  to a flow), the `code` is `200001`. The `missing` property contains
  all the requested flows.
- If some flows are missing, the `code` is `200002` and the `missing`
  property lists them.

actions.title: Place.Electricity.getFlowsSetup
actions.description:
Get the mapping of functionalities to electricity flows.

A functionality is attached to *at most* one flow.

actions.title: Place.Electricity.selfConsumption
actions.description:
Compute the self-consumption rate of the *Place* on a time period.

`selfConsumption = 1 - (elec_feed_in / elec_total_usage)`

when.description: A time part of the time span.

span.description: Timespan: H (hour), D (day), Wmo (week starting on Monday), Wsu (week starting on Sunday), M (month), Y (year)

actions.title: Place.functionalities
actions.description: Get the list of *Functionalities* available in this *Place*.

devices.description: Devices selector. Device tags or device classes or device ids or '*' for any. Multiple values are separated by '|' and interpreted as « OR ».

functionalities.description: Functionality selector: Functionality tags or functionality class (optionally, '@' followed by a endpoint in decimal) or '*' for all. Multiple values are separated by '|' and are interpreted as « OR ».

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Place.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata.

actions.title: Place.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: Place.notifications
actions.description: Get the list of *Notifications* available in this *Place*.

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Place.newNotification
actions.description: Create a new *Notification*.

actions.title: Place.programs
actions.description: Get the list of *Programs* available in this *Place*.

embed-metadata.description:
Request to include the given keys of metadata in the response. If a key doesn't exist on the resource it is ignored.
**Note:** This only applies to the top level resources.

actions.title: Place.newProgram
actions.description:
Create a new *Program*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Place.run
actions.description:
Run an *Action* on zero, one or multiple *Functionalities* selected with tags.

*Device* and *Functionality* selection are combined with « AND ».

If no functionality is matched by the device/functionality selection, an empty array is returned.

devices.description: Devices selector. Device tags or device classes or device ids or '*' for any. Multiple values are separated by '|' and interpreted as « OR ».

functionalities.description: Functionality selector: Functionality tags or functionality class (optionally, '@' followed by a endpoint in decimal) or '*' for all. Multiple values are separated by '|' and are interpreted as « OR ».

actions.title: Program.delete
actions.description:
Delete a *Program*.

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Programs.get
actions.description: Get information about a *Program*.

actions.title: Program.patch
actions.description:
Modify a *Program*:
- name
- status (enabled/disabled)
- code

**Note**: requires full access to the *Account*.

actions.title: Program.log
actions.description: Get the execution history list of this *Program*.

to.description: End of the interval. Default: now.

actions.title: Program.getMetadata
actions.description: Get the metadata of the *Program*.

actions.title: Program.patchMetadata
actions.description:
Modify the metadata of a *Program*.
Keys are limited to the same format as tags (up to 21 characters, [a-z0-9], starting with [a-z]). Values can be any JSON value.

actions.title: Program.run
actions.description:
Launch the *Program*.
The result will be available later in the run history.
